etymology.description: 橙(橙) (chéng, "orange") + 汁(汁) (zhī, "juice") means juice derived from oranges.
etymology.interpretation: The term 橙汁(chéngzhī) logically combines 橙(橙) (chéng, "orange") with 汁(汁) (zhī, "juice") to refer to a liquid extracted from oranges, commonly known as orange juice.

examples.chinese: 我喜欢喝橙汁(我喜歡喝橙汁)。
examples.english: I like to drink orange juice.

examples.chinese: 夏天来临时(夏天來臨時)，一杯冰橙汁能带来清凉(一杯冰橙汁能帶來清涼)。
examples.pinyin: Xiàtiān láilín shí, yī bēi bīng chéngzhī néng dàilái qīngliáng.
examples.english: When summer arrives, a glass of iced orange juice brings coolness.
